En el año 2009 se lanza este gran FPS, un shooter con una historia atrapante, muy completo y variado, muchos mapas, armas y clases para disfrutar, cada clase puede llegar hasta el nivel 6 (Maximo), en cada nivel desbloqueas mejoras acordes a tu clase, ya sea mas municion, mas velocidad, menor tiempo de recarga, etc. El juego consiste en enfrentar oleadas de Especimines, hasta un con un maximo de 6 jugadores online, con varios niveles de dificultad, al terminar una oleada tenes la opcion de ir a comprar al "trader", para recargar municion, comprar armas o cambiar de clase. La ultima oleada Se considera fuera de las previsas es decir, si son 10 oleadas, la 11 es la final, con un Boss muy fuerte "The Patriach", quien tiene muchas armas, mucha velocidad, gran cantidad de vida y ganas de aniquilar a todos.

Graficamente esta muy bien trabajado para aquel año, faltan unos retoques pero se matuvo muy actualizado, lamentablemente hoy dia ya no hay muchos servidores ON, debido a la salida de su sucesor, Killing Floor 2, altamente recomendado ya que sigue los pasos de su antecesor.

7.4 / 10

Edited 05-27-2015
Unfortunately this game has been messed up due to poor networking...

If you want to play with friends it will not always work as you will keep getting a "server not responding" error message and will not be able to play with friends.

The game does this in private listen server (host ran server) as well as public servers.

This game has only started doing this recently and I think that they may have done this because Killing Floor 2 has been put up on early access.

Edit 06-19-2015
There is a workaround for the "server not responding" you have to manually add the ip.
Good luck finding that in the forums as they do not even mention this fact... nor is there a simple sticky or other type of info... even though this problem has been around for "years".

Rather fun, especially with friends. If you are a graphics lover it may not be for you. But otherwise the gameplay is solid and teamwork means you'll have a good time. Well worth the price, especially when it goes on sale. Teamwork is pretty essential though games can easily be solo'd. Levelling is an absolute grindfest which isn't particularly welcome. Maps range from pretty fun to not very fun at all, so take care.

Fun-wise it's about 8.5 with others, 8 on your own. Overall the game is about an 8. Absolutely worth the price considering the amount of times it goes on sale and the seasonal events that happen.

For fans of FPS games, especially Horde type. 

Quite possibly some of the best gunplay in a game, and some of the most disturbing enemies depending on the event. 

Uses the "acient"  UT2.5 engine so it's not super demanding of a title. Most anyone with a computer made since 2009 with a dedicated GFx card can play it. The leveling system is an absolute grind fest, however by the time you get yourself to the max levels you know what you need to do, and spawn with a powerful weapon in which to do it.
Killing Zombies!!

This game is 100 times better than free, virus-ridden porn.  I'm terrible at playing Killing Floor because I have one hand down my pants the entire time.  I take one look at clot (or even better, a bloat) and immediately spew goo all over my underwear.  Watching them convulse and growl while being sawed in half brings me so close to climax that, yes, I did just walk into you and push you off the roof into a group of sirens.  Hnnnnnnnghhhh.

This game is incredible.  It is a little short on features compared to some other shooters however that doesn't stop it from being fun.  It's a simple concept, survive waves of zomebies (called 'specimen') and go shopping for bigger guns and more ammo in between rounds.  It's great, simple fun and can be a blast for a very long time.  The constant addition of maps from the developer and the community keeps the game fresh as well as the newer game mode in which there is actually a mission to perform.

In summary it's definitely not a complex game but it is definitely a good one.  Plus it's almost always on every major Steam sale for $5 so there's really no reason to not pick this one up.

Kill zombies. Polished gameplay. Polished sound design-- I can almost feel the recoil every time I fire my pistol. Blood and gore (yay!).  Level up and increase your abilities. 6 different player classes to choose from each with an emphasis on a different type of weapon and style of play. Customize the length and difficulty of each map. Play with up to 5 friends. Oh, did I mention after the last wave of undead, there's this boss called the Patriarch? I really hope you have friends. Friends you can count on.
Choose your favorite way to destroy the mutant specimens whether it's shotguns, rifles, flamethrowers, explosive, or precision weapons and get in there.
A must get game despite the odd hit boxes and the love It or hate It voice acting.

If you like zombies and killing them just as much. GET THIS GAME! Wave after wave of different types of zombies just waiting to be slaughtered.  With 8 different classes to choose from you can always switch up how you play and as you use the classes you can even level them up for different weapon perks and store discounts!  Plenty of weapons to choose from will make you and your teamates almost unstoppable..but be weary of the Patriarch, he doesn't take to kindly to the killing of his "childeren".
There is no reason at all not to play this game.

4/5

Killing Floor is a fantastic wave-based solo or co-op first person shooter. The shooting is super solid, while giving you many weapon choices from axes, chainsaws, shotguns, pistols etc. 

Many incentives to level each class as you become more efficient in your abilities such as to heal teammates or have more shotgun damage, things of that nature. The second game is out as of now but I still find myself playing this on and off. Says almost 60 hours but I know I have played it maybe twice that since its release. 

5/5 if you like hearing a British lady say "money" over and over though. Trust me, it happens. 

I clearly have to come back to finish this review.
Greatest zombie game out there imo!

"Behind you!" Get use to hearing that. With the next wave bringing better weapons and harder monsters. This a game of team work and tension, a great mix for shooter and metal fan. With season based updates, there is always something to do!

Ridiculously fun co-op horror fps. Can become very repetitive but multiple classes can change up your gameplay style and make the experience a little more fresh. Holiday events are always adding a new look to the game also.

Rating: 5/5     "Do not hesitate in buying this FPS. You will not be disappointed."

If you're looking for a good all-around zombie-killing game, definitely take a pause to check this game out. It's filled with all the basics, including flamethrowers, pistols, sniper weapons, explosives, rockets...and if you're like me, you'll definitely appreciate the added medic-gun, which provides basic self-defense and a team-healing alternative fire. Killing Floor does not boast the best graphics, and lacks a real story...but it was intended to be a game one can just jump right into, and when you take into account the active fanbase, it leaves very little room to be disappointed. So if you're in favor or at least impartial to mindless zombie torture, give this game a shot...HEADSHOT! Haha!

The only competitive FPS that has come close to defeating TF2 as my favorite. With so many amazing modes and weapons, there are a lot of great ways to play. From zombie stand-offs all the way to huge 32 player gun-game team deathmatches with low gravity, this game has something for everyone.

これは協力的なサバイバルホラーシューターです。公式リリースのずっと前にこのゲームに出会った。それでも、「キリングフロア」は「レフト4デッド」のパロディと呼ばれ、本格的なゲームとは見なされていませんでした。しかし、彼女はまだ人々の注目を集め、それによってより明るい未来への道を開いた。
ここで何がそんなに特別なのか、多くの人にはわかりませんか？その雰囲気の中でゲームの機能全体。ここでは、プレイヤーがお互いに馴染みがなくても、行動に協力して協力するようにすべてがねじれています。しかし、誰かがめちゃくちゃになりました...アドレナリンが提供されます。
誰もがこのゲームを魅力的に感じるとは限りませんが、その時間を一滴も費やしたことを後悔していません。彼女は私に新しい友達とポジティブな感情を与えてくれました。
